DOC.brief_summary: The primary goal of this study is to determine if there is an association between greater exposure to vancomycin and the development of nephrotoxicity. The secondary goal is to estimate the costs to the hospital associated with these nephrotoxic events.
DOC.criteria: 18 years or older at time of hospital admission Had an absolute neutrophil count of ≥ 1000 cells/mm^3 Received > 48 hours of intravenous vancomycin therapy Had one or more vancomycin trough levels reported within the 96 hours after therapy initiation Had a baseline serum creatinine level of < 2.0 mg/dL and baseline creatinine clearance level of ≥ 30 mL/min Previous diagnosis of cystic fibrosis
